Question:
What are the features of the RX261 and RX260?
Answer:
The RX261 and RX260 mainly have the following features.
Outstanding power efficiency: The RXv3 core that operates at up to 64 MHz delivers the high performance of 355 CoreMark. On the other hand, the active current is kept to 69 µA/MHz, and the standby current to 1 µA.
Snooze mode: Power consumption during intermittent operation can be minimized by using snooze mode to operate some of the peripheral functions in software standby.
Advanced touch functions: A third generation capacitive touch sensing unit (CTSU2SL) is incorporated, which offers improved noise immunity, water resistance, and low power consumption functions compared with the previous generation CTSU.
Robust security IP: Only RX261 includes security IP (RSIP-E11A) with built-in encryption engines and an access management circuit that prevents unauthorized use of the encryption engines, as well as a key management function that prevents data leaking to the outside by making the key valid only within the security IP.
Program protection: An area protection function that enables setting non-rewritable areas in flash memory is included, making it suitable for storing a secure boot firmware.
High speed, highly reliable communication functions: The RX261 only is equipped with USB full speed (host/function) and CAN FD, so the communication functions are enhanced.
RX261: https://www.renesas.com/en/products/microcontrollers-microprocessors/rx-32-bit-performance-efficiency-mcus/rx261-microcontrollers-outstanding-power-efficiency-advanced-touch-functions-and-robust-security
RX260: https://www.renesas.com/en/products/microcontrollers-microprocessors/rx-32-bit-performance-efficiency-mcus/rx260-microcontrollers-outstanding-power-efficiency-and-advanced-touch-functions
